title: Citi Holds China Day Event in Dubai
summary: Dubai – "With over 3500 Chinese companies present today in the UAE, including energy, construction, telecommunication and trading firms, and establishing regional offices that cover the whole of the Middle East and Africa market, Dubai has evolved into a major trade and business hub for top Chinese multinationals. This is evidenced as well by the number of Chinese residents in the country, a number that has doubled within a year to more than 200,000."
tag-1: Citi Holds China Day Event in Dubai
tag-3: Dubai – "With over 3500 Chinese companies present today in the UAE, including energy, construction, telecommunication and trading firms, and establishing regional offices that cover the whole of the Middle East and Africa market, Dubai has evolved into a major trade and business hub for top Chinese multinationals. This is evidenced as well by the number of Chinese residents in the country, a number that has doubled within a year to more than 200,000."
tag-4: These figures were part of the opening remarks by HE Zhan Jingbao, Consul General of The People's Republic of China in Dubai, during the China Day, a focused client event organized recently by Citi's China Desk that involved 43 guests from 25 top Chinese corporations with extensive business interest in the region.
tag-5: China Day was an opportunity for Citi's Global Subsidiaries Group (GSG), a focused client segment for Citi serving multinationals in more than 170 markets around the globe, to brief Chinese clients on the latest corporate banking, trade finance and treasury solutions, as well as furnish relevant economic research.
tag-6: This event follows the establishment early this year of Citi's dedicated China Desk covering the Middle East, Egypt and Pakistan and based in Dubai, in response to increased trade and investment flows into this region from China, and in order to support more closely its Chinese clients as they continue to go global and expand overseas.
tag-7: Working seamlessly with other China desks in the Americas, Europe, Africa, Singapore and Hong Kong, the Middle East's China Desk serves Chinese corporations active in the wide Asia-Middle East geography, leveraging Citi's extensive network, product platform and proven business model in serving global companies at home and abroad.
tag-8: "The China Day falls within our strategy to deepen our existing and time-tested partnerships with our valued Chinese clients around the world," said Mike Pendill, Middle East Head of Citi's Global Subsidiaries Group (GSG). "The UAE is an ideal trading hub and location of choice for global firms including Chinese firms and is further complimented by Citi's regional platform in Dubai that offers fully integrated banking solutions to Chinese firms that operate throughout the Middle East and Africa."
tag-9: Allan Ao, Middle East China Desk Head at Citi, said: "Through a dedicated banking team on the ground, we can deliver the full capabilities of Citi by facilitating opportunities and cross-border activities to Chinese multinationals active in the region."
tag-10: Citi has been in the Arab world for nearly 50 years and views the region as critical to its global franchise. It currently offers full scale corporate banking services across ten Arab countries including Egypt, UAE, Lebanon, Jordan, Tunisia, Morocco, Algeria, Bahrain, Qatar and Kuwait as well as Pakistan.
tag-11: Citi's on-the-ground capabilities include Investment Banking, Capital Markets Origination, Equity Sales & Distribution businesses, Global Transactions Services, Equity Research and Global Islamic Banking serving the MENA region.
tag-12: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
